events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description: Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series. Input, Process, Output Sunday 11 January, 1pm – 7pm FREE The MediaLab at LASALLE College of the Arts presents an engaging and varied body of student works, including new musical instruments, design prototypes, and image-making machines.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Starting with Kanban: A practical workshop on Value Stream Mapping and WIP
events.description: So you’ve heard about this Kanban thing and want to know where to start, or maybe you’ve been using it for a while and you want to know where to go. In this hands-on workshop, we'll start at the very beginning and teach you how to build a Value Stream Map and use that to define your initial Kanban and WIP limits. If these terms don’t make sense to you, then you need to come to this workshop. Want to learn more: • Learn how to create your VSM; the commonly overlooked practice of modelling the functional steps in your business processes - anything from IT to finance • Track the flow of work through your VSM on your Kanban wall • Learn how to use your VSM, team size and process efficiency to calculate your initial WIP. • Learn how to embed a culture of Kaizen If this sounds interesting, come along for a fun interactive workshop by Evan Leybourn A pizza / beer sponsor has not yet stepped forward. Contact me if you are interested!
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, 22nd Floor, One Marina Boulevard, NTUC Cebtre

events.name: Double Bill! Apache Hive + ScalaJs
events.description: Lloyd from PayPal will be giving a talk on ScalaJS. ScalaJS is a Scala to Javascript compiler which allows you to write your entire web application in scala. This talk will provide an introduction to ScalaJS and some of the cool stuff related to it. Raymond will be talking on Apache Spark. Apache Spark has been touted as the next big thing in the big data space. The fact that Hive and Mahout have ditched the MapReduce approach and are moving their code base to Spark, is a smoking gun. If you are wondering what it is and what you can do with it, join us to find out! There'll be Pizza and drinks so please RSVP to help us get an estimate on how much to order!
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Creative Crew Talks - January Meeting 2015
events.description:
An Event for People Who Love to be Inspired 
Creative Crew Singapore is a non-profit organisation devoted to spear the development of the local community for greater learning.  We explore the learning evolution - learn unique experiences with tools or stories to give shape to ideas, and what are the trends that will shape how you'll work and think.  
We hold a series of talks and workshops by some of the brightest minds from design, development, experience and technology. 
  
 Photos credit to Peter Lim   

An evening on design techniques to improve your day to day creative work 
  
Programme Details 
  
Using Adobe Illustrator efficiently as a Designer By Mark Plunkett 
When it comes to designing layouts and creation of logo, you will most likely be using Adobe Illustrator as your number one software. It doesn’t really matter if you are a beginner or an advanced user of Adobe Illustrator, the hottest topic would be about why Adobe Illustrator takes so long to load and save a file. 
In this session, Mark Plunkett - Director and Designer of Dexel, a graphic design agency will share about some of his most used tips and features during projects at his workplace. 
  
Creative design tools for Mobile App Developers By Arul Kumaran 
Hear from Arul Kumaran, CTO and Multiplatform Developer at Luracast Singapore to share his experience on the design and development of mobile applications. Developers will also need to know design tools well in order to better market their apps. 
In this session, you will explore some of the techniques using image editing tool, Adobe Photoshop and screen design tool, Adobe Fireworks on developing mobile apps.  He will also share some of the plugins that can make them even more powerful and helpful for the given tasks. 
  
Allow your designs to shine By Linus Lim 
One of the design principles is to create order and hierarchy in your designs resulting in beautiful and easy to read layouts. In this session you will learn the tips to apply alignments into your designs to give them a professional edge. 
Icons are used everywhere in user interfaces for websites and mobile apps. The design principle for designing icons is to keep them simple, modern and friendly. Linus will also share how he draws icons for your screen design. 
  

  
Meet Our Speakers 
  
 
  
Mark Plunket 
Mark Plunkett is the Director and Designer of Dexel Pte Ltd, a professional graphic design agency specialising in Branding, Web Design, Digital Publishing, Copywriting, Graphic Design and Adobe Training in Singapore. Mark is an Adobe Certified Expert in Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe InDesign, Adobe Captivate and Adobe Digital Publishing Suite. He is also the appointed Adobe Community Professional in Singapore specializing in Adobe InDesign and Digital Publishing Suite. Mark holds a Bachelor of Art (BA) in Communications and Media Management, an Advanced Certificate in Training and Assessment (ACTA) and an Adobe Certified Instructor (ACI) with vast experience and industry exposure, equipping him with highly diverse skills-set which includes organizational management, effective communication, and multi-tasking workflows. 
Mark has been an efficient Graphic Designer since 2002, during which he has attained a consummate level of expertise in art direction, creative conceptualization, and DTP skills of print content and online media. A solid and sustained commitment to the communication and design industry has seen Mark rise to managing his own graphic design agency, supporting and consulting MNC companies on print and digital publishing in Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia and Thailand. 
  
 
Arul Kumaran  
Arul Kumaran is the CTO and Multiplatform Developer (Web, Desktop, Mobile) at Luracast Singapore, focusing on API development and consultancy. 
He has also authored and open sourced a php based web api framework called Restler which is widely used around. 
  
 
Linus Lim 
Linus Lim is the President for Creative Crew and Singapore official Adobe user group manager.  
By profession, Linus is a UI/UX designer who believe that great product does not come by chance. What's so amazing is we are all users of great products and good user experience isn't so much the technology that makes it possible, but how one is able to shift the thinking required to make it the first place. 
Linus also manages Fireworks CC, a screen design tool for UI / UX designers. 
  

  

 

Who should attend? This talk is suitable for anyone who want to learn and meet awesome people. 
  
Where is the talks held in the Toa Payoh Public Library? We are located at Level 1, Programme Zone 
 
 
  

 
 

Admission Rules 
It's a Free Seating Event. 
Networking with speakers will commence after the event. 
  
Duration: 
Approx 2 hrs  
  
Venue: 
6 Toa Payoh Central Singapore 319191 
  
How to get there: Nearest MRT Station : Toa Payoh Nearest Bus Interchange : Toa Payoh Central Buses : SBS Transit 56, 105, 153, 232 via Toa Payoh Central SBS Transit 8, 26, 28, 31, 73, 88, 90, 139, 142, 143, 145, 155, 157, 159,  163, 231, 235, 238 via Toa Payoh Interchange 
  
Like us on Facebook 
  
  
Meet the Sponsor
events.location: Toa Payoh Public Library, Programme Zone, 6 Toa Payoh Central, Singapore 319191

events.name: Seminar: Wes™ - Simple Your Western | 14 Jan 2015
events.description:
Abstract 
Simplifying Westerns with ProteinSimple Technology   Size-based separation of proteins is important for the identification and qualification of protein targets. More specifically, the ability to perform true quantitation of proteins in a highly reproducible and timely manner is crucial to successful characterization.  
ProteinSimple aims to make western blotting as simple as possible. Here we present Wes™ , a unique, automated size-based separation and nano-immunoassay platform. It detects and characterizes protein molecular weights in denatured protein lysates at low picogram levels, automatically performs all the manual steps typically associated with traditional Western analysis techniques and provides true quantitation of results upon completion of an experiment 
Join us for the seminar on 14th Jan and find out how to identify and quantify your protein lysate/samples in just 3 hours! 
Who Should Attend 
Researchers who are losing lots of precious time to western blots   Researchers who need reproducible quantitative protein data 
Details 
14 Jan 2015 (Wed), 10am - 11am  Singapore General Hospital, Academia Level 4, AC4-3  
Refreshments will be served. 
Speaker 
Fugang Deng  Field Application Scientist, Protein Simple 
  Enquire 
Leonard Lim  Email: leonard@sciencewerke.com  Contact No: +65 6777 1045 / +65 9018 3679
events.location: Singapore General Hospital, Outram Road, Singapore 169608

Why Did You Choose to Quit Your Job and be a SAHM?

events.name: Introduction to JSON-Autotype
events.description: It would be a good way to celebrate a new year with a Haskell Talk. In January, Michał J Gajda, the author of hPDB ( http://hackage.haskell.org/package/hPDB ) is going to share his exciting new work: json-autotype to help Haskeller write Web Application API. Here is his description for the content of the talk. ====== There are huge APIs written entirely in JSON, and thus untyped, and unsafe to call. The traditional way to deal with this problem in strongly typed languages like Haskell, is not to examine untyped `Value` type provided by the parser, but rather write conversion functions for intended API types, and thus ensure type checking on a boundary between Web application and Haskell code. I propose to use an automatic tool json-autotype, to generate datatype declarations with Aeson's FromJSON instances from a set of example .json files. That greatly speeds up the process, and allows for very quick and well checked interfacing relatively large APIs. I will also explain the theory behind this tool. Package is available on Hackage and GitHub: https://github.com/mgajda/json-autotype . ====== About the Venue: http://www.theoffice.com.sg/where.php
events.location: The Office, 75A Pagoda Street Singapore 059234

events.name: From Quantum Physics to Water Pearls
events.description:
We are delighted to offer tickets to the official opening event of the MajuLab, a new joint French-Singaporean research centre in quantum and condensed matter physics (read more about the lab here). 
Join us at NUS University Hall for accessible talks by eminent speakers starting from 1.30pm on Monday 19 January. 
PROGRAMME: (scroll down for full talk details) 
13h30 - 14h00 official speeches and welcome address 
14h00 - 15h00 Manipulating Atoms with Photons and Photons with Atoms by Claude Cohen-Tannoudji (Collège de France, Nobel Prize in Physics 1997) 
15h00 - 16h00 What can we do with a quantum liquid? by Tony Leggett (University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, United States, Nobel Prize in Physics 2003) 
 16h00 - 16h30 coffee/tea break 
16h30 - 17h30 Quantum property testing by Ronald de Wolf (Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica, the Netherlands)  
17h30 - 18h30 Water pearls by David Quéré (PHHM and Ecole polytechnique, France)  
Registration is free but required. The UMI kick-off event will continue 20-22 January with more specialised scientific talks intended for researchers. Find the full programme here.  
   

  
TALK DETAILS: 
Manipulating Atoms with Photons and Photons with Atoms 
Claude Cohen-Tannoudji (Collège de France, Nobel Prize in Physics 1997) 
It is possible to use the basic conservation laws in atom-photon interactions for manipulating atoms with photons. It will be shown in this lecture how it is possible in this way to polarize atoms, to cool them to very low temperatures, in the microkelvin, and even in the nanokelvin range. A review will be given of recent developments in this field, including ultra-precise atomic clocks, with errors less than one second in one billion years, the realization of new states of matter such as Bose-Einstein condensates, matter waves and atom lasers. New perspectives opened by these results will be briefly discussed. It is also possible to manipulate photons with atoms. By sending atoms in a cavity containing photons, one can prepare mesoscopic linear superpositions of photon states and study how they are destroyed by the decoherence processes resulting from the coupling with the environment. By analysing the state of the atoms when they exit from the cavity, one can also detect the presence of a photon in the cavity without destroying it. 
What can we do with a quantum liquid? 
Tony Leggett (University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, United States, Nobel Prize in Physics 2003) 
Quantum liquids are physical systems which display the effects not only of quantum mechanics but also those of quantum statistics, that is of the characteristic indistinguishability of elementary particles.The most spectacular manifestations of quantum statistics are the phenomenon of Bose-Einstein condensation and the closely related one of Cooper pairing; in both cases a finite fraction of all the particles in the system are forced to all do exactly the same thing at the same time, and as a result effects which would normally be obscured by thermal noise may become visible, sometimes spectacularly so. I will review some examples of such behavior in degenerate alkali gases, superconductors and superfluid helium-3. 
Quantum property testing 
Ronald de Wolf (Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica, the Netherlands)  
"Property testers" are algorithms that can efficiently handle very large amounts of data : given a large object that either has a certain property or is somehow “far” from having that property, a tester should efficiently distinguish between these two cases. In this talk we describe recent results obtained for quantum property testing. This area naturally falls into three parts. First, we may consider quantum testers for properties of classical objects. We survey the main examples known where quantum testers can be much more efficient than classical testers. We also describe one new result : a quantum algorithm for testing whether a given n-bit Boolean function f is a k-junta (i.e., depends on only k of the n input bits) using roughly sqrtk queries to f, which is quadratically faster than the best classical testers. Second, we may consider classical testers of quantum objects. This is the situation that arises for instance when one is trying to determine if untrusted quantum states or operations are what they are supposed to be, based only on classical input-output behavior. Finally, we may also consider quantum testers for properties of quantum objects, such as whether two states or unitaries are equal, whether a state is separable, etc. This is based on joint work with Ashley Montanaro (survey arXiv:1310.2035) and with Andris Ambainis, Aleksanders Belovs, and Oded Regev (k-junta testing). 
Water pearls  
David Quéré (PHHM and Ecole polytechnique, France)  
We show how special materials found in Nature shape water in quasi-spherical pearls. We focus on the functions generated by these materials, such as water (and even oil) repellency, self-cleaning effect, anti-fogging abilities or super-aerophilicity. We also emphasize the very unusual dynamical behaviors of liquids generated in such situations, and discuss in particular the nature of the residual friction associated with these non-wetting states.
events.location: University Hall Auditorium, Level 2, Lee Kong Chian Wing, 21 Lower Kent Ridge Road, Singapore 119077
events.group_name: Centre for Quantum Technologies, National University of Singapore

events.name: Singapore Gophers January Meetup
events.description: Happy New Year Gophers! Hope you are excited for the first meetup of the 'Year of Gopher' (http://twitter.com/davecheney/status/550276404026150912). Here's the line-up for the Meetup: * Customising Your Own Web Framework in Go Jonathan Gomez, Engineer @ Zumata At Zumata we use Go in our main API. We've chosen a mix of using the Go standard library and bite-sized open-source components (i.e. handling routing/middleware/persistence), rather than adopting a fuller web framework, or relying purely on the standard lib. This talk outlines our experiences, and aims to help you get started building and structuring your APIs in Go. * Adventures in IoT with Golang Lakshan Perera & Audrey Lim Sharing our little experiments in trying to power anything and everything with Go. * Pop Quiz (10-20 mins) We are introducing a new segment from this year, so come prepared to write code (bring your laptop or a pen & paper) As usual, there will be pizza.
events.location: Nitrous IO, 1 Trengganu St, 2nd Floor, Singapore 058455, Singapore

events.name: 5th ASEAN "Bridges" Event Series - Professor Brian P Schmidt, 2011 Nobel Laureate for Physics
events.description:
Keynote speaker: 
Professor Brian P Schmidt is a 2011 Nobel Laureate for Physics at the Australian National University. In 1994, Professor Schmidt and Professor Nicholas Suntzeff formed the HighZ SN search team, a group of 20 astronomers on five continents who used distant exploding stars to trace the expansion of the Universe back in time. The group’s discovery of an accelerating Universe was a startling one suggesting that an unknown force is countering the effect of gravity and pushing the Universe apart.  
Professor Schmidt continues his work using exploding stars to study the Universe, and is leading Australian National University’s Research School of Astronomy and Astrophysics’ effort to build the SkyMapper telescope. 
Jointly hosted by NUS and Yale-NUS College, this public lecture is part of the International Peace Foundation’s “Bridges – Dialogues Towards a Culture of Peace” speaker series at NUS. 

  
“Science: Humanity’s Universal Bridge”  
Science is one of the few arenas where humanity has worked together through history for our collective good. In his speech, Professor Schmidt will discuss the role of science through the ages in shaping our current society, reflecting on the good and the bad its knowledge has brought. While science's impact in our daily lives is higher now than ever before, to cope with future challenges the world will need further improve how it works together. It is through continual advances in our knowledge that we can hope to have the billions of the world's inhabitants live in peace and prosperity into the future.
events.location: Shaw Foundation Alumni House Auditorium, Level 2, 11 Kent Ridge Drive, Singapore 119244

events.name: Introducing Application Security in Your Organization - Think Like a Developer
events.description: In this session, the speaker, Sandeep Nain, from HP Australia and a former co-lead from OWASP Melbourne Chapter, will cover the following topics: 1. How to build secure development lifecycle for development teams using modern software development methodologies 2. Challenges of enforcing secure development lifecycle at an enterprise scale 3. Reasons why most application security programmes fail and how we can collaborate with development teams for easier enterprise adoption Come join us for our 1st 2015 meetup which comes with free pizzas and soft drinks, courtesy of HP Fortify. PS: Please take note of our new meeting place in NUS.
events.location: Seminar Room 10, COM1 Building #02-10, 13 Computing Drive, NUS, Singapore 117417

events.name: "Future Cities: Prospects and Projections"@Urban Lab
events.description:
Join us for the launch of Urban Lab, a new dedicated exhibition space by URA that profiles the most innovative solutions for a sustainable and liveable urban environment. Urban Lab will open with its inaugural exhibition, ‘Future Cities: Prospects and Projections’ by FCL. This is a showcase of trans-disciplinary research on cities, urbanisation, and global environmental sustainability for the creation of a sustainable urban future. Come and find out how science, design and technology are shaping the landscape of our cities.  
  
FAQs 
  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
By public transport, the nearest MRT station is Tanjong Pagar MRT Station. Please use Exit A and walk along Peck Seah Street.  
By car, you may park at the URA East Wing car park. Please use the lift to access the link bridge on the second floor. Follow the signs for Singapore City Gallery, and take the escalator to the first floor.    
  
Is my invitation transferrable? 
Yes, in the event that you are unable to attend you may nominate someone to take your place. Please kindly inform the organisers. 
  
Do I have to bring my printed invitation to the event? 
No, you do not need to bring your invitation to the event.
events.location: Urban Redevelopment Authority, The URA Centre Atrium, 45 Maxwell Road, Singapore 069118
events.group_name: Urban Redevelopment Authority and Singapore-ETH Centre

events.name: Using Freelancers to grow your business - Elance-oDesk
events.description:
Thousands of Singapore-based companies are already growing their business using the technical, creative, and sales talent found on oDesk.  
You’re invited to join a hands-on training on Monday, January 26th. Learn how to hire a qualified developer to build your mobile app, work with a graphic designer to update your website, or find a talented sales representative that can add value to your funnel.  
● Find an area of your business that can be easily tasked to a freelancer 
● Create a job post that gets noticed   
● Choose the right freelancer at the right price 
● Communicate and complete your project  
Plus we’ll divulge some best practices from our most successful clients. 
What is Elance-oDesk? 
Elance-oDesk is the global leader in online work – our sites Elance.com and oDesk.com help businesses find freelancers and work together via the Internet. We can help connect you with qualified designers, writers, marketers and mobile app developers. If the work can be done online, you can find someone to help you on Elance-oDesk. On our platform we have: 
● 2.7M+ jobs posted annually 
● Over 2,600 skills - from web development to social media to virtual assistants 
● Freelancers in over 180 countries 
Find out why 86% of companies believe that business hiring online will soon be common  -- and see exactly how it’s done. Plus we’ll divulge some best practices from our most successful clients. 
  
It’s your chance to ask questions and get hands-on help from your local Startup Mobilizer, Jerry Koedding.
events.location: The Hub, 113 Somerset Rd, Singapore 238165

events.name: January Meetup
events.description: Happy 2015! May it be full of new Ruby goodness, great people and hot pizza. Rather coincidentally, you can find all of that at our first meetup of 2015 this January 27th at 7pm. Venue: Microsoft Singapore, Level 21 Auditorium, One Marina Boulevard See you there! -------------- 1. You ;) 2. 3. * Hot Picks - This is a 5-10 minute session during which anyone can stand up and say something interesting! -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices, so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips" that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must have came across some interesting Ruby nuggets in the last month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw or winstonyw@gmail.com, or Anna @anna_fil or annafil@gmail.com. See you all soon! -------------- Job Postings -------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting? Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. -------------- Thank You, Sponsors: Venue and Drinks: Microsoft (Singapore)
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: It's 2015 let's start something - GeekGirl Meetup Launch and Startup Stories from Singapore
events.description:
It's 2015 - let's start something 
  
Geek Girl Meetup Launch Event:  
Startup Stories from Singapore 
  
28 January, 2015 | 6.30pm - 9.30 pm | The Working Capitol 
  
Geek Girl Meetup, the global community for women intrested in tech, code, startups and design is launching in Singapore in 2015. We've invited speakers to help inspire us to make this year about change and starting something new, whether it’s your own business, a new hobby, learning a new language or learning how to code. 
We proudly present our first speaker, who's an expert in change, Grace Clapham, co-founder of The Change School. 
Grace Clapham 
 
  
 The event is hosted by the newest and hottest co-working space in Singapore The Working Capitol. 
 

  
Why should you attend? 
GeekGirl Meetup aim to highlight female role models by inviting them to take the stage and share their expertise, knowledge and inspire others to learn new skills with the focus on tech and business. 
A Geek Girl Meetup is all about meeting other likeminded girls and women to team up with to start working on fun and intresting projects.  
The GeekGirl community was founded in Sweden in 2008 and has from there spread to Denmark, Germany, Mexico, the US, the UK, and Hong Kong. The Geek Girl Singapore team currently consists of Erica Hanson, Katie Evans and Magdalena Krön. If you're intrested in getting involved send us an e-mail on geekgirlmeetupsg@gmail.com. 
Follow us us on twitter and like us on Facebook.
events.location: The Working Capitol, 1 Keong Saik road, Singapore 089109

events.name: .NET Developers Meetup #2 : Developing Web
events.description: Hi .NETers, We will have our second .NET Developers Community Singapore meetup. Please join this meetup. There will be .NET news, coding, etc. sharing from the community and expert as well. We are very excited that this meet up will be at held at The Colony at *SCAPE, our Programme Partner. Direction : If you are using a bus, you can alight at Nat'l Youth Council bus stop (bus number: 7, 14, 16, 36, 65, 77, 106, 111, 123, 174, 174e, 175, 971E) and just cross the road. If you are using MRT, you can alight at Somerset MRT station (NS23) first and 5 minutes walk to the venue. Nearby landmark: Cineleisure Orchard . AGENDA • Latest news on .NET Open Source (open floor sharing). Try .NET... • Setting up ASP.NET MVC . See how you prepare setting up ASP.NET MVC. Migrating packages.config to project.json for server packages, using bower instead of nuget to fetch client libraries, using grunt instead of build script to compile typescript and less and to run JavaScript unit test, setting up MVC, Web API and SignalR and using Kestrel to run the application on a Linux VM. - by Nguyen Quy Hy • Dependency Injection with .NET MVC/WebAPI . Dependency injection is a powerful and fundamental software design pattern to building loosely coupled, highly unit testable software. Explore the 3 main ways of dependency injection (Constructor, Setter, Interface) and look at a simple and practical approach towards implementing IoC for any .NET MVC/WEB API project. - by Donovan Huang • Creating your own website using ASP.NET MVC 5 + AngularJS from 0 to go live . You can just learn or you can follow to create the website and add public domain name. I buy the domain from Namecheap.com , quite cheap only $3.98 per year. The presentation is fully step-by-step walk through, so by the end of the presentation, your own website will go live. You can update your own website easily from Visual Studio. I'm going to use angulargo template to create the website or someones template if more interesting. You need to bring your laptop if you want to follow me step-by-step. - by Riza What else... • Food will be available, thanks to from Microsoft Singapore. • YES!!! the Door Prize from unnamed sponsor for one lucky member, is this WD for you...???
events.location: *SCAPE The Colony, #04-01, 2 Orchard Link, Singapore 237978

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm ArtScience Museum Lobby The full line-up of ArtScience Late until January 2015 can be viewed here:http://bit.ly/artsciencelate For one evening a month, ArtScience Museum transforms into a night-time platform for artists in the fields of performance and new media to experiment, explore, discover and challenge their artistic boundaries. Come to a space where interaction, collaboration and experimentation are de rigueur of the night, and chill out with music and our bar overlooking Marina Bay. Hypermnesia 8pm & 9pm featuring Composit formed by Shunsuke Francois Nanjo (Japan/France), Kensuke Christophe Nanjo (Japan/France) and Nicolas Charbonnier (France) in collaboration with Eisa Jocson (The Philippines) The installation Hypermnesia is the result of artists and mechanical engineers working together. The team have developed for this unique occasion an interactive pole installation for the internationally celebrated choreographer/performer Eisa Jocson. The artwork will react to her body heat and movement, and the audience is also invited to interact with the artwork through touch, altering the sound in the background. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Patty Paperie - Colored Calligraphy Session
events.description:
We have a new and more exciting workshop this February:  a color session!  
If you are bored of writing with black ink, then this is the session for you.  As you know, everything is just prettier with colors (especially gold :) )  So for this workshop, we're going to learn how to write with colors on white and and black paper.  Colored calligraphy is fun, but can be expensive if you don't know which tools to use and how to use them.  So I'll spare you of the trouble and teach you :)   
Color Session Details:  
Date:  February 7
Time:  2PM - 5PM
Venue:  Swiss Bake Cafe, Harbourfront Centre
Fee:  $105
 
 Participants must have experience in handling a pointed pen already.  Participants must also bring their OWN pen holder and nib.  The rest of the kit will be provided, including:  

various paint colors (including white and gold)
pipette
brush
white paper
black paper

  
If you are interested, email me so I can send you the bank details.  Please note that the workshop slots are transferrable, but not refundable.  If you are going to transfer your slot, please let me know immediately. 
For snippets of my work, visit my instagram account (@pattypaperie), my blog (pattypaperie.wordpress.com) or the undying facebook (facebook.com/PattyPattyPaperie). 
Any other inquiries, email me at pattypaperie@gmail.com
events.location: Swiss Bake Cafe, HarbourFront Centre,  Maritime Square, #01-58/59/60, Singapore null

events.name: Learning Haskell and using Yesod as a production API backend by @Calvin Cheng
events.description: Haskell is an obscure language in comparison with other popular languages/frameworks like python/django, ruby/rails, javascript/nodejs and is usually not considered in 'mainstream' start-up projects. I decided to take a look and found it an impressive language that I am comfortable using, for a new production app in my company. Our current app uses golang for the API backend. I would like to share my experiences (and pain :-p) learning the language and why I am happy with it as our API backend for a new app.
events.location: Plug-In@Blk71

events.name: Reduce Manufacturing Defects and Scrap with Schematic Creation to Your 3D Electrical Designs
events.description:
Take your electrical schematics to the next dimension SolidWorks Electrical 3D enables you to use your schematic data from SolidWorks Electrical with your overall mechanical design, opening up a new level of productivity. Concurrent design between electrical and mechanical teams can now be a reality—in real time. You can collaborate easily and naturally, optimize the overall product design, and streamline development.  
  
Key capabilities include: 

Real-time bi-directional updates between 2D and 3D synchronize electromechanical design so everything stays coordinated throughout development
Integration of the 2D schematic with the 3D model helps standardize designs and unify your BOMs to reduce mistakes and delays
Placement of the electrical system and cables/wires in your 3D model enables planning of specific locations and paths for consistent product manufacturing

 



  
EVENT TITLE 
Reduce Manufacturing Defects and Scrap with Schematic Creation to Your 3D Electrical Designs 
  
WHO SHOULD ATTEND 
Electrical Engineers, Middle Management and other Engineers who want to learn about SolidWorks Electrical (2D & 3D Integration) and how ATE will value add in meeting engineering challenges. 
   
AGENDA 
02:00pm: Critical Pain Points of Electrical Engineers During the Four Stages of Design 
02:30pm: 2D to 3D Electrical Integrated Workflow 
03:30pm: Hands-On Walkthrough 
04:30pm: Funding Options to Defray Costs 
04:40pm: Q&A

events.name: Big Data for Social Good Challenge (See Details for Start/End)
events.description: THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE BEGINS NOVEMBER 10, 2014 AND CONTINUES TO MARCH 3, 2015. CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service . Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found. Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded.... Register here: http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/ What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix. Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page . The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size. Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets !
events.location: Big Data for Social Good Challenge, Web only, Singapore

events.name: Lets meet at Big Data Conference in Singapore
events.description: Big Data conference is a platform for Singapore leading analytic and business intelligence leaders to address the challenges and tap on the opportunities in leveraging Big Data in this unique market. It is a marketplace for the regional business leaders and IT executives to access the very best of ideas & technologies in adopting and improving big data and analytic practices and strategies. Theme: Driving Business Success Big Data Conference focus on:- - Deciphering the haystack - Semantic Web Technology Travel Planner Application (Approach for modernizing tourism domain using technology) - Panel Discussion - Why Big Data is relevant for IT? - Big data and Hadoop masterclass tutorial - Big Data Innovation Read more Benefits of attending - This event concentrates on practical applications and exploitation of big data. - It aims to cut through the marketing hype and help participants understand - The pro's and con's of the new and powerful analytic tools (both open source and proprietary) - security & governance issues and special areas of application - Emerging challenges for CIO’s and information professionals. - What are the skills set required? Why Implement Big Data? Big Data - Accelerate your business - Re-develop your products - Perform risk analysis - Keeping your data safe - Create new revenue streams - Customize your website in real time - Reducing maintenance costs - Offering enterprise-wide insights For more detail click here For online registration click here For offline registration, please send the following details to [masked] Name | Email ID | Contact No | Designation | Organization Name For this meet up group 10% discount on registration fee

events.name: Lets meet at Cloud Conference in Singapore
events.description: Cloud computing continues to be the way of the future and many studies indicate that more than 50% of all information technology will be in this new paradigm within the next five to ten years. This transformation has great implications for emerging markets which have the potential to leap frog mature markets in their adoption of cloud computing, combine cloud computing and mobile technologies to introduce unique services that can transform the lives of billions, drive a much larger scale of adoption and challenge existing price points, while presenting unique challenges in areas such as security and user interfaces to cloud computing. Theme : Cloud Computing: Opportunities, Issues, and Challenges & Big Data Innovation: Driving Business Success. Key Topics - Cloud Computing- Mindset, Business and Technology Chang - Designing Infrastructure for Enterprises on Public Cloud - Panel Discussion : Sharing Resources on cloud value - - - Development Model and Environment for Dynamic Mobile Cloud Services - Security of Virtual Working on Cloud Computing Platform - Local Authentication and Authorization System for Immediate Setup of Cloud Environments - Cloud Champions League, Switzerland - Final Corporate Quiz Benefits of attending • Increased speed in responding to unforeseen events. • Easy to get the latest and greatest updates. • Adoption is quick and simple. • Improved information security. • Deployment time decreases from years to months. Audience for the Conference 2014 (Not limited to) Heads of Business Development, Strategy Directors, Directors, Telecommunication Managers, Communication Directors, Heads of Sales, Heads of Call and Contact Managers, VPs of Technology, Product Managers, Business Development Managers, Storage Managers, Business Analysts For More detail click here For registration on line click here For offline registration, please send the following details to [masked] Name | Email ID | Contact No | Designation | Organization Name For this meet up group 10% discount on registration fee

This Conference brings together leading IoT companies, Start-Ups and the developer/ Professional community to exchange their ideas with the practical application and utilization of Internet of Things. events.name: Hebocon Singapore (Robotics competition for the technically ungifted)
events.description: The search for Singapore's worst robot will take place some time this year (most likely in July 2015). Known as Japan’s "worst robot competition”, the purpose of the HEBOCON event is to find out which crappy robot is the ultimate failure of them all through a sumo-styled wrestling battle. Preparations are being made to bring this quirky robotic competition to Singapore. We are looking for venue hosts, sponsors, contributors and supporters for this inaugural event. More details about guidelines and rules of competition will be announced in March 2015. Meanwhile stay cute and unskillful! If you're interested to participate, please indicate your attendance here. Thank you. *the date indicated below is a tentative one. the confirmed schedule will be release in Mar 2015 For more information about HEBOCON, check out the official page at https://www.facebook.com/Hebocon.Official
events.location: TBD
